Question.Text: A 23-Year-Old Farmer from Myanmar with a 3-year history of left-sided scrotal swelling. The swelling is non-tender and non-reducible

Answer: Lymphatic filariasis with hydrocele - The farmer from Myanmar presents with chronic non-tender, non-reducible scrotal swelling over 3 years. The images show massive hydrocele and microfilariae of Wuchereria bancrofti on blood smear. Lymphatic filariasis, transmitted by mosquitoes, causes chronic lymphatic obstruction leading to hydrocele (most common manifestation in men), lymphedema, and elephantiasis in endemic tropical regions.
